title: How to Copy and Paste Google Books

steps.title: Click a book link to open it in your browser.
steps.content: Click a book link to open it in your browser. You can also use the search function at books.google.com to find a book.

steps.title: Make sure your screenshot includes all the text you want to copy.
steps.content: Make sure your screenshot includes all the text you want to copy. Then, save it to your computer. If you're not sure how to take a screenshot on your computer, you can follow the steps here for some help.

steps.title: Type drive.google.com into the address bar.
steps.content: Type drive.google.com into the address bar. Then, hit ↵ Enter or ⏎ Return on your keyboard. If you're not automatically logged in, click the Go to Google Drive button and sign in with your Google account.

steps.title: This button is located in the upper-left corner of your Drive library.
steps.content: This button is located in the upper-left corner of your Drive library. It will allow you to upload a new file or folder to your cloud. Your options will pop up on a drop-down menu.

steps.title: This option will open a new pop-up window.
steps.content: This option will open a new pop-up window. It'll allow you to select a file to upload from your computer.

steps.title: Select your screenshot image in the file navigator window.
steps.content: Select your screenshot image in the file navigator window. Click the Open button to upload it to your Drive.

steps.title: This will list your right-click options on a drop-down menu.
steps.content: This will list your right-click options on a drop-down menu.

steps.title: A sub-menu will pop up with a list of available Google apps.
steps.content: A sub-menu will pop up with a list of available Google apps.

steps.title: This will open your screenshot in a new Google Docs document.
steps.content: This will open your screenshot in a new Google Docs document. Google Docs will automatically recognize all the text in your screenshot, and copy it to the bottom of the document as editable text.

steps.title: Find the copied book text at the bottom.
steps.content: Find the copied book text at the bottom. Click and drag your cursor over the text you want to copy. This will highlight the selected text in blue.

steps.title: Your right-click options will pop up on a drop-down menu.
steps.content: Your right-click options will pop up on a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Selecting "copy" will copy the selected text to your clipboard.
steps.content: Selecting "copy" will copy the selected text to your clipboard. If you want to use a keyboard shortcut, you can press ⌘ Command + C on Mac or Control + C on Windows to copy.

steps.title: Your right-click options will pop up.
steps.content: Your right-click options will pop up.

steps.title: Selecting paste will paste the copied book text here.
steps.content: Selecting paste will paste the copied book text here. As a shortcut, you can press ⌘ Command + V on Mac or Control + V on Windows to paste.
